intro: Odontarrhena szarabiaca, commonly known as the East African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in dry, sandy soils. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and woody. Odontarrhena szarabiaca is known for its milky sap, which is characteristic of the milkweed genus.
